questions.question: What is the most widely used semiconductor material for fabricating integrated circuits in modern chip manufacturing?
options: Germanium
Copper
Silicon
Aluminum
Gold

questions.question: In the digital IC design flow, what is the primary role of the "synthesis" stage?
options: To convert a gate-level netlist into a physical layout.
To verify the timing performance of the physical layout.
To translate a high-level Register Transfer Level (RTL) description into an optimized gate-level netlist.
To simulate the behavior of the circuit under various test conditions.
To determine the optimal placement of standard cells on the chip.

questions.question: In advanced low-power digital IC design, what is the primary purpose of "power gating"?
options: To dynamically adjust the operating frequency of specific blocks based on workload.
To reduce dynamic power consumption by disabling clock signals to idle modules.
To completely shut off power to inactive circuit blocks, drastically reducing static leakage power.
To optimize the power delivery network by distributing power rails more efficiently.
To convert AC power into DC power for internal circuit operation.

questions.question: In synchronous digital circuit design, what does the "critical path" primarily represent?
options: The path with the fewest logic gates between two flip-flops.
The longest combinational delay path between any two sequentially clocked elements (or input/output ports), determining the maximum operating frequency.
The path that consumes the most dynamic power in the circuit.
The routing path that is most susceptible to electromagnetic interference.
The shortest signal propagation delay path in the entire chip.

questions.question: In computer architecture, what does an Instruction Set Architecture (ISA) fundamentally define?
options: The physical layout and interconnects of the processor chip.
The set of all micro-architectural optimizations implemented in a specific CPU design.
The abstract interface between the software (programmer) and the hardware (processor), including instructions, registers, and memory addressing modes.
The communication protocol used between the CPU and external memory devices.
The manufacturing process technology used to fabricate the CPU.
